case_title: Mst. MUGHLAN And Others vs AMIR BADSHAH And OTHER
complaint_summary: The petitioners challenged the adjustment of 40 Kanals of land from their Khata to the respondents' Wanda during consolidation proceedings, alleging improper condonation of delay and incorrect ownership determination by the Collector (Cons.).
investigation_summary: The case involved examination of land records, including Register Haqdaran Zameen 1979-80 and sketch maps prepared by the Patwari (Cons.), to determine rightful ownership and possession of disputed land parcels.
judgment_summary: The court accepted the revision petition, set aside the orders of the Additional Commissioner (Cons.) and Collector (Cons.), and restored the original consolidation scheme. The court found that the Collector (Cons.) had improperly condoned a 25-year delay and made adjustments without verifying the records.
Decision_or_verdict: Revision petition accepted; original consolidation scheme restored.
legal_arguments: Petitioners argued that the disputed land (Khasra No. 5791/3201) was purchased and possessed by them since 1963 and was wrongly adjusted to the respondents.
Respondents contended that the land was jointly purchased and owned by the petitioners and Imam Din, and the adjustments were in line with consolidation laws.
sections: Section 13 of the Consolidation of Holdings Ordinance, 1960
key_issues: Improper condonation of delay in filing appeal.
Incorrect ownership determination of disputed land.

legal_terms.Wanda: A term used in land consolidation referring to allocated land parcels.
legal_terms.Tattima: An adjustment or correction in land records.

words_and_phrases.Khasra: A land parcel number in revenue records.
words_and_phrases.Khata: A revenue record of land ownership.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around a land ownership dispute during consolidation proceedings. The petitioners successfully argued that the Collector (Cons.) improperly adjusted their land to the respondents' Wanda without verifying records and condoned a 25-year delay in appeal filing without justification. The court restored the original consolidation scheme.

petitioners.claim: Disputed land belongs to petitioners as per mutation and possession since 1963.
petitioners.objection: Collector condoned time-barred appeal without justification.
petitioners.contention: Orders of lower courts are factually incorrect and legally flawed.

respondents.claim: Disputed land was jointly purchased by petitioners and Imam Din.
respondents.justification: Adjustment of land was in accordance with consolidation law.
respondents.defense: Delay in appeal filing was rightly condoned.

findings.respondent_1_action: Signed register scheme but filed time-barred appeal.
findings.additional_commissioner_error: Dismissed appeal without addressing key issues.

judgment.decision: Revision petition allowed. Orders of Additional Commissioner and Collector set aside. Original consolidation scheme restored.
